I test drove a lesser trim and knew I liked that vehicle, the two drivers being fuel efficiency and if I could get my cello in the back seat. Timeliness, dealer tack on fees for documentation, etc... overall price of vehicle.  I have concerns that Ford Motor Company will still be in business in 10 years based on the 3 quotes I received for Ford dealers.  Your trucks are overpriced.  Relying heavily on overpriced Trucks/SUV is not sustainable over the long run.  Salaries have remained stagnate across the US since 2007 yet truck prices from Ford and GM have more than doubled. Frustrating. I asked for an out the door price EXCLUDING taxes/rebates I am not eligible for (I want the 0%/72). The reply: "I have the keys in my hand right now, when are you coming in".  No attempt to answer my question;  if I wanted to come in, I wouldn't be shopping online.  After saying I'm 2 hrs away, I repeat my question.  Then they want my address for "tax purposes".  GA has a statewide Ad Valorem tax which is the same for everyone. I'll assume they were not doing an unauthorized pull of my credit.  As a reminder, I requested the price of the truck without taxes 2 previous times.  Next response was from the manager where I have to repeat myself and after more back/forth I get a price $3k higher than advertised.  When you click "e-price" it's more $$$!  I finally say it's too rich for my blood and move on but they say what a good price it is and how $3k is not a big deal.  If it's not a big deal than they should have accepted my offer which was buying the truck at the price I saw online.

Dealer sales B.S.. Ford has by far overpriced their vehicles compared to normal inflation and wage growth. I guess most people are just gullible and don't consider the impact of their ignorance. Ford and all retailers play on that ignorance. If they sold the all year long at the prices they discount to at year end, volume and profits would increase.

It's always a pain in the ass dealing with car manufacturers and retailers. For example, if I want the big engine I have to get the high priced trim package.  If I want the price I have to negotiate it out of the salesman. The entire process feels like I am being taken to the cleaners. I just want the truck I want for the price I want. I don't want all these stupid techno-features that are little more than a distraction. I don't need carpets and leather in a work truck.  What I do need is the big engine and the heavy duty transmission. Then there's your website. Crap, I can't build the truck I want. Shit I clicked on something that transmitted my contact info to some dealer who will either ignore me completely, or hound me ceaselessly. Ford used to represent the working man by building trucks that were tough and made for work.  Now you make these namby pamby trucks with totally inappropriate materials and expensive, silly and distracting techno-gimmicks.

I asked a simple question of how much everything would cost after my trade-in and instead of a solid  Number that allows me to contemplate the math, I merely got what the monthly payment amount was that was supposedly a ?really special deal that the truck was eligible for?. We all know that is BS.   I know that sales training probably says to not give the customer the full price  until they are emotionally bought in because of the risk of sticker shock but I?m not an idiot and do not like to be taken for an idiot by being given just some pie in the sky monthly number spread out over 72 months.   But by him actually breaking down the math for me, that actually told me that the ?special deal? was not a very special deal. And that he was also screwing me on my trade-in. In my vehicle search, I received contact, from 3 different Ford Dealerships, Platinum, Rockwall, and Paul Murray,  each Dealerships Rep, treated my needs, and concerns, differently. That does not change my Perception of Ford Motor Company. It did however, decide, which of the 3, dealerships, I would turn to, when I am ready to purchase a vehicle.

I would have preferred to have chosen the rating of N/A, than poor, even though no one contacted me. My interest was actually in an Expedition, and not an Explorer, and it wasn't until I recieved the email that I realized that I had chosen the wrong vehicle. I did however, look at the Explorers to be sure that they would not fit what I had in mind, and unfortunately, they do not.

Leanna Mohundro, of Rockwall Ford, in Rockwall TX, contacted me immediately, by email, text, and phone call. She and I spent the better part of the morning, viewing vehicles on Rockwall Ford's Website, going over every feature from Top, to bottom, Front to back, Best Price based on what I told her that I was interested in, as well as Best Offers that Ford had going on at that time. She was kind enough to keep in mind my needs, and offered her advice, only when asked. This young lady, was extremely professional, kind, and patient. She sent me an application, looked over it when I sent it back to her, and was kind enough  to call me back, to advise me, of how, she thought, it would be percieved, with the finance Department, we discussed my finance options, if I chose to proceed, or not. I was, above, and beyond, impressed with the time that she took, and how she handled everything.

That was $6000.00 of your shitty product needing repairs just out of factory warranty traded in.  There is nothing wrong with the cooling line it is the brittle oring flattening out and getting brittle from the turbos heat.  PUT OUT A RECALL AND FIX IT.
